arts.ttl: Lacroix: These celebrations are in the DNA of Palace
arts.sum: After celebrating reaching the FA Cup semi-finals with Crystal Palace, Maxence Lacroix says his and his teammates’ rapport with the supporters are what makes the club so special.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace's FA Cup win to impact Liverpool's Premier League title challenge
arts.sum: Crystal Palace are into the FA Cup semi-final after they beat Fulham at Craven Cottage, and their Premier League clash at Arsenal will now have to be moved as a result

arts.ttl: Cup exit a ‘punch in the stomach’ for Fulham – Silva
arts.sum: Marco Silva described Fulham’s FA Cup quarter-final defeat as “a big punch in our stomach” – and insisted they should have played against 10 men for much of the match. Crystal Palace stormed to a 3-0 victory at Craven Cottage, crushing their opponents’ hopes of a trip to Wembley and of potentially reaching the final […] The post Cup exit a ‘punch in the stomach’ for Fulham – Silva appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: With elite Eberechi Eze, Crystal Palace will be a match for any team at Wembley | Barney Ronay
arts.sum: Maverick attacker seemed utterly in control as he produced two stunning moments of skill to decide Cup quarter-final Play at Wembley. Score at Wembley. Score again. Go back to Wembley again. Yeah. Did I mention Wembley? Eberechi Eze has had a fairly decent last five days of his footballing life, bookended here by a performance of supreme incision on a crisp, boisterous day in south-west London, when he was the very obvious point of difference between Crystal Palace and Fulham. Not just in his numerical contribution to Crystal Palace’s 3-0 win: a jaw-dropper of an opening goal, all thrilling, controlled power; followed by a proper, actual high-skill assist. But also in terms of style and a Palace system that leans right into its own strengths when all the parts function like this. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Fulham 0-3 Crystal Palace: Player ratings as Eagles cruise into FA Cup semi-final
arts.sum: Rodrigo Muniz saw an effort flash agonisingly wide in the early stages of a first 30 minutes which were controlled by Fulham, but the sight of Jefferson Lerma's stunning volley crashing back off the crossbar changed the tone of the game and it was not long after that Eberechi Eze put Palace ahead. Cutting in from the left, the England international bent a beautiful effort into Bernd Leno's bottom corner, and Eze turned creator just moments later as his cross into the box was headed home by Ismaila Sarr seven minutes before the break.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner: Crystal Palace are in ‘crunch time’ of season after reaching FA Cup semi-final
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner says Crystal Palace are entering the “crunch” point in their season after securing a spot in the semi-final of the FA Cup. “We will get into out best shape again.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner shows why Jurgen Klopp wants him after taking Crystal Palace to FA Cup semis
arts.sum: Crystal Palace thrashed Fulham 3-0 to reach the FA Cup semi-finals at Wembley, with Oliver Glasner continuing to do a superb job at Selhurst Park that has seen him pick up admirers from both Bayern Munich and Red Bull Leipzig

arts.ttl: Fulham 0-3 Crystal Palace: Emphatic Eagles set club record as "unbelievable" Eberechi Eze reaches new landmark in FA Cup win
arts.sum: "Unbelievable" Eberechi Eze reaches a new landmark and Crystal Palace set a new club record after beating Fulham 3-0 at Craven Cottage to reach to the FA Cup semi-finals.

arts.ttl: FA Cup quarter-final: What we learned from Fulham 0-3 Palace
arts.sum: One five-minute blitz later, Eberechi Eze had taken the tie away from the hosts – and taken Crystal Palace to their second FA Cup semi-final in four years. The draw will take place on Sunday 30 March following the conclusion of the match between Preston North End and Aston Villa, which kicks off at 13:30 BST.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner leads praise for Eberechi Eze as Palace make FA Cup semi-finals
